experience: You and Steve both know Neil Giuliano, Aric Zion, and 92 others

We develop content in several areas: books, periodicals, film and video, direct mail, Internet. We also provide ghostwriting and editing services, and we offer complete video production facilities, specializing in 16:9 HD acquisition and Final Cut Pro HD editing.

In addition to writing my own books and coauthoring a book with Dr. Ken Blanchard, I have ghostwritten a number of books and edited many more. Check out various books by Ken, as well as by Michael Gerber, Gerard Long, Mike Ingram, and Chris Camillo to see my work! More to come, including projects by John Rost and Rich Wilkerson.
I offer a 2 1/2 day interactive seminar on all aspects of writing as a career, based on the highly acclaimed course I taught at Grand Canyon University.

Gottry Communications Group (originally founded as Visual Communications Services, Inc.) was an award-winning full-service advertising agency based in Bloomington, MN, a suburb of the Twin Cities. We served a variety of local and national clients, including Harper San Francisco, Warner Bros., World Wide Pictures, United Properties, Prudential Realty Group, Good Value Homes, Standard Publishing, Fleming H. Revell Company, Career Press, Bioplasty, Inc., Alpha Video, Newtek, Inc., Crown College, and Tyndale House. We won a number of national awards, and were named "Small Company of the Year" in 1991, by the Bloomington Chamber of Commerce.

summary: The Vision, and therefore the Purpose, of my small, agile company—Priority Multimedia Group, Inc.—is to "Create, market, and distribute original content—in a variety of formats—that impacts individuals and organizations in positive, meaningful ways."Here are some of the things I've done, and am doing, to fulfill my vision and purpose:I am a published author, accomplished ghostwriter, and produced screenwriter. I wrote COMMON SENSE BUSINESS (HarperCollins) and co-authored (with Ken Blanchard) THE ON-TIME, ON-TARGET MANAGER (Wm. Morrow), and I have more books on the way, including 8 books with Mark Victor Hansen, "Mr. Chicken Soup." Among my work-for-hire projects are 3 books by Michael Gerber, author of the E-Myth series, and THE BREAKTHROUGH, a parable by Gerard Long (published by Alpha USA).In November, 2010, my stage play, THE BITTER SEASON, was produced by  Imaginations Theatre, LLC. The 8 performances, with a talented cast supported by a great crew, were well-received. (The play is an adaptation of a screenplay about racism that I first developed in 1997.)As to screenwriting, even many of my friends do not realize that I wrote the screenplay for the most-watched children's movie/video of all time. (In fact, it's been dubbed into more than 146 languages.) I also wrote the adaptation of Max Lucado's bestseller, JACOB'S GIFT.I was named "Writer in Residence" at Grand Canyon University (gcu.edu) in 2004, where I taught "English 498: Writing as a Career." I developed all of the course materials.I offer private coaching on writing and teach a one-day seminar on starting and growing a small business, titled THE BIG IDEA.Prior to its folding in mid-2006, I was a regular contributor to SUCCESS Magazine. (I am convinced I had nothing to do with its demise, and it has since come back under new ownership!)A good starting point to discover how I may be able to contribute to your future can be found at www.SteveGottry.com.My quote: "I play on WINNING teams!"Specialties: If you need a ghostwriter or an editor who can bring relevant new content to your book project, please contact me. My recent ghosting projects include THE E-MYTH INSURANCE STORE by Michael Gerber and John Rost (coming in 2013), THE MASTER PLAN, by Mike Ingram (Dust Jacket Press, 2012), and ANYONE, ANYWHERE, ANYTIME, by Rich Wllkerson (2013). Other projects include Michael Gerber's AWAKENING THE ENTREPRENEUR WITHIN (HarperCollins, March, 2008) and THE E-MYTH ENTERPRISE (HarperCollins, 2009).
name: Steve Gottry
title: Author, Ken Blanchard coauthor, Ghostwriter, Screenwriter, Producer, Director, Teacher, Toastmaster. And I love it all!
